basics.name: Manuel Santamariña Ruiz de León
basics.label: Take apart. Tinker. Modify. Overcome.
basics.summary:
I'm an aspiring developer from Galicia, Spain. Had a passion for computers since I was little, tinkerer by nature and overall your friendly neighbourhood nerd.

Currently studying a Computer Science Degree @ UDC... but I'm still open to any promising adventures ;)

work.name: IT Support
work.summary: Started repairing computers since I was young as a side-job. There I got used to being concise and exact in communicating with people.
highlights: Got used to treating with people and getting into their true necessities.

awards.title: OSHWDem 2017: Arduino line-follower robot race
awards.summary: Awarded to the second fastest time and best design due to the use of an inside-out approach in the line-following algorithm that permitted live error correction and for the use of upcycled materials.

projects.name: harmony.
projects.description: Angular + Spring based music database application developed during CampusDual's full-stack development bootcamp.

projects.name: COVIDLog
projects.description: Front-end design & implementation of three different apps (Desktop + Mobile + Web) for a Human-Machine Interfaces assignment.
highlights: Learned software engineering good practices here.

projects.name: Pacomeralgo restaurant
projects.description: Software Methodologies assignment which consisted in interviewing a client and documenting a realistic restaurant digitalization endeavour, complete with its UI design. The sample design for the restaurant was done in Figma.
highlights: Learned software engineering good practices here.

projects.name: lightride
projects.description: Arduino-based lighting system for inline skating.

projects.name: server dashboard
projects.description: Expansible server dashboard for domotics and remote server access

projects.name: YNQJMAEPM!
projects.description: Arduino + vanilla JS based voting system for birthday parties.
highlights: I have a sense of humour.

projects.name: OSHWheel
projects.description: ATMega32u4-based DIY OSHW steering wheel made with VR simracing in mind
